panels.description:
All instances among pgsql cluster ${cls}

Instance: Goto PGSQL Instance

IP: Goto PGSQL Node

Status: Goto PGSQL Service

Load: max(cpu,postgres,pgbouncer)

Space: Disk space usage max(all device)

Proxy: session number, Goto Haproxy Admin Page
panels.title: Cluster Members

targets.expr: count by (ins)(pg_pubrel_count{ins="$ins"}) > bool 0 or on() vector(0)

panels.description:
Which services are routing to this instance ?

Click goes to PGSQL Service Dashboard
panels.title: Service

targets.expr: max by (cls,ins)(pg_repl_replay_lag{ins="$ins"} or pg:ins:lag_seconds{ins="$ins"} or pg_lag{ins="$ins"})

panels.description:
Overall pressure for this PostgreSQL Node and Instance. 
max(node:ins:cpu_usage, pg:ins:load, pgbouncer:ins:load)
Alerting event graph. Each stripe represent an alerting Event. Gray transparent stipe are pending alerts.

Average transaction response time from Pgbouncer.
You can use PostgreSQL metric after PG14

targets.expr:
# pgbouncer:db:xact_rt_1m{ins="$ins"}
pg:db:active_time_rate1m{ins="$ins", datname!~'template\\d'} / pg:db:xact_total_rate1m{ins="$ins", datname!~'template\\d'} # PG14

panels.title: RT

panels.description: Transactions per seconds for each database in Last 5 minutes
panels.title: TPS

panels.description: Tuples fetched, inserted, updated, delete among this cluster
panels.title: CRUD

panels.description: Time spent per second for each query of each instances.
panels.title: Statements RT

panels.description:
R▲ for disk read bandwidth
TX▲ for network transmit bandwidth
RX▼ for network receive bandwidth
W▼ for disk write bandwidth
panels.title: Disk / Network

panels.description: Recent logs for pgbouncer & patroni & postgres
panels.title: Recent Logs

list.description: IP address of this postgres instance
list.label: IP
list.name: ip

list.description: Sequence number of this instance, which is an unique integer among a postgres cluster
list.label: Sequence
list.name: seq

list.description: Cluster identifier for this postgres instance, cls should be unique among entire environment. such as pg-meta, pg-test
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cls

list.description: Node name of current postgres instance
list.label: Node
list.name: node
